Uploading iOS app to App Store
An iOS-based app can be added to App Store by following the steps:
Signing up
and
Setting up
a developer account in Apple Developer.
Setting up
an Apple App Store Connect account to connect Apple and GreenData accounts and registering the app in the Apple App Store Connect.
Preparing the necessary information and content for the application, including description, screenshots, graphics, etc.
Creating the app in the
personal account
in the
Mobile apps
section.
Filling in the necessary metadata and settings for the app.
Testing
the application build (if necessary).
Passing the Apple review with the
requirements
and
recommendations
.
After successful verification,
publishing
the app in Store.
Signing up in Apple Developer Account
To publish an iOS mobile app under the personal brand requires the individual
Apple Developer
account, Apple requires software vendors to register apps under the accounts of the end owners who are responsible for the content and operation of these applications.
Creating a developer account takes about 2 weeks.
To launch mobile iOS apps via the GreenData account, the Apple Developer account must be created as a company (legal entity) account, since it is not possible to add a GreenData account as a team member in an individual account, which is necessary to connect to the GreenData account.
To publish apps through an Apple Developer account, an annual subscription is required. To work with the GreenData Personal Account, it is enough to purchase a standard subscription (not Enterprise), but specify in the Company/Organization status in settings. The subscription is paid annually. By opting out of the auto-renewal option, the subscription renewal is done manually. Otherwise, all released apps will be removed from the App Store within 24 hours after the paid subscription period expires.
Required data for creating Apple Developer account:
Apple ID
— using an existing one or creating a new one. Apple ID and Apple Developer accounts are not the same thing. (more information about creating an Apple ID account is described on the
website
). It is recommended to use mail in the domain zone associated with the company as the mailing address, since in the future Apple may request it when registering the Apple Developer account as Company/Organization. It is also recommended to use an email address that several people in the company will have access to, since Apple will send important messages and notifications about released apps to this email.
D-U-N-S number
— a unique identifier assigned to the company through Dun & Bradstreet (D&B). Apple requires all companies that register in the Apple Developer Program to provide a D-U-N-S number. It is used by Apple to confirm the identity and legal status of a company registering as an Apple Developer (more information about getting a D-U-N-S number for free is described on the
website
). In the process of receiving the D-U-N-S number, an Apple representative can call the phone number specified during registration and additionally request legal documents for the company to clarify the information. The registration time for the D-U-N-S number can take up to 30 days.
Creating account
To create an account, the developer must perform the following:
on the
Apple Developer Program enrollment
, click "Start Your Enrollment";
page, click "Start Your Enrollment";
log in with an Apple ID (additionally specify the two-factor verification code received on the mobile device);
read and accept the Apple Developer Agreement;
to continue registration on the site, click "Continue enrollment on the web";
next, specify the "Company / Organization" account type  and click "Continue";
in the "Organization Information" section, specify the following information:
in the "Legal Entity Name" field, specify the company name (it must be identical to the previously entered name when registering the D-U-N-S number);
in the "D-U-N-S Number" field, specify the previously received D-U-N-S number;
fill in the CAPTCHA and click "Continue":
if an error message appears in the "Legal Entity Name" field, click "update your D&B profile" and send the company information. The procedure will continue after the profile is updated;
on the "Summary for Review" page, read and confirm the information. Next, select "This is the correct headquarters address for my organization" and click "Submit";
If successful, Apple will send a confirmation letter to the email address from the Apple ID with a link to pay for membership as an Apple developer. Follow the link and pay for the subscription.
As a payment method, it is recommended to specify the same method that was previously used with the Apple ID, it reduces the potential problems with subscription charges.
Setting up Apple Developer Account
Identifiers Registration
Publishing the app requires to register four IDs in the Apple Developer account.
To do this, select "Identifiers" on the main account page in the "Program resources" section:
In the section that opens, next to the "Identifiers" heading, click
to register a new application identifier.
On the page that appears, leave the "App IDs" item selected and click "Continue".
Then leave the "App" type selected and click "Continue".
Setting
Purpose
Description
Enter the application ID in the com companyname appname format, where the
companyname
must be replaced with the company name, and the
appname
with the future name of the application.
Bundle ID
Select "Explicit".
In the field under the setting, enter the application ID specified in the "Description" field, in the
com.companyname.appname
format.
The identifier format allows only Latin letters, numbers, hyphens and dots.
Capabilities
Check the following boxes:
App Groups
Associated Domains
Communication Notifications
In-App Purchase (selected as default)
Push Notifications
Don’t select "Broadcast Capability" item.
Next, click "Continue" and then "Register".
The registered ID will appear in the list.
Three more identifiers must be registered in the same way:
com.companyname.appname.notification-service
(identifier for the notification service),
com.companyname.appname.share-extension
and
com.companyname.appname.widget
, where the first part of
com.companyname.appname
should match the previously registered application identifier. and in the list of "Capabilities" it is necessary to mark only the "App Groups" item (the  "In-App Purchase" item remains always selected by default).
As a result, four format identifiers should appear in the list of identifiers:
com.companyname.appname
com.companyname.appname.notification-service
com.companyname.appname.share-extension
com.companyname.appname.widget
where
companyname
is the name of the company and
appname
is the name of the app.
Groups registration
Next, register two groups as follows:
on the "Identifiers" page in the upper right corner, click "App IDs" and select "App Groups" from the drop-down list:
in the window that opens, click
next to the "Identifiers" heading;
on the page that appears, leave the "App IDs" item selected and click "Continue".
on the page that opens, in the "Identifier" field, enter the group identifier in the
group.com.companyname.appname.widget
where the part of
com.companyname.appname
should match the previously registered application identifier;
in the adjacent "Description" field, specify the same identifier in the
group com companyname appname widget
format (with spaces instead of dots);
click "Continue" and then "Register".
The registered ID will appear in the list.
Repeat the steps for the
group.com.companyname.appname.share
group ID.
As a result, four format identifiers should appear in the list of identifiers:
group.com.companyname.appname.widget
group.com.companyname.appname.share
where
companyname
is the name of the company and
appname
is the name of the app.
Matching IDs and groups
After registering groups, specify them in the "App Groups" item for previously created IDs. To do this, click on "App Groups" in the upper right corner and select "App IDs" again in the drop-down list. Next, click on the
com.companyname.appname
identifier and click "Configure" in the "App Groups" item.
After that, both groups must be marked in the drop-down list
group.com.companyname.appname.widget
and
group.com.companyname.appname.share
and then click on the "Continue" button. Next, click on the "Save" button and click on the "Confirm" button in the notification that appears. The ID has been successfully updated.
Repeat the steps for the remaining identifiers in according to the table:
Group
Identifier
group.com.companyname.appname.widget
com.companyname.appname
com.companyname.appname.notification-service
com.companyname.appname.widget
group.com.companyname.appname.share
com.companyname.appname
com.companyname.appname.share-extension
Setting up Apple App Store Connect Account
Connecting of Apple and GreenData accounts
To connect the Apple and GreenData accounts, add the GreenData account to the development team associated with the Apple Developer account. To do this, sign in to the
Apple App Store Connect
with the Apple ID that was previously used to register for the Apple Developer program. After signing in, select the "Users and Access" section on the main screen:
On the page that opens, click
and enter in the window that opens the following information about the account used by GreenData to create apps via the personal account:
Setting
Purpose
First name
User’s first name
Last name
User’s last name
E-mail
mail@greendata.pro
Roles
Admin
After selecting the "Administrator" role, all other roles will be marked automatically.
Additional resources
After selecting the "Administrator" role, all other roles will be marked automatically.
Click "Next" and "Invite" buttons in a new window. After sending the invitation, wait for confirmation from GreenData. Contact GreenData
support
in case confirmation is overdue..
Registration of the app in the Apple App Store Connect
Before publishing the application via the personal account, register the application in the Apple App Store Connect. To do this, on the App Store Connect page, switch to the "Applications" tab and then click
next to the "Applications" heading on the page that appears. In the drop-down list, select "New app".
In the window that opens, specify information about the app you are creating.
Setting
Purpose
Platform
Select "iOS".
Name
Specify the name of the created app.
The name of the app must not exceed 30 characters.
Primary language
If the information about the app on the App Store page is not localized for some countries or regions, the information in the selected primary language will be used.
Bundle ID
The main application’s Bundle ID .
SKU
The main application’s Bundle ID .
User access
Limited Access — if the app is created for a certain group of users;
Full Access — for public distribution of the app.
After all settings are filled in, click "Create".
Creating an app to publish on the App Store
Go to the
Mobile apps
section of the GreenData personal account and create an image for further publication in the App Store.
For more information about the process of creating a mobile app, see the
Creating custom mobile app
article.
Fill in information about the application
On the page of the newly created app, enter basic information:
Setting
Purpose
Preview videos and screenshots for iOS
Screenshots and videos of the app. Screenshots are required for both the iPhone and iPad versions. The screenshot format is specified in the tips on the page and must be strictly followed.
Advertising text
Advertising information about the app.
The parameter is optional.
Description
A brief description of the main idea of the app, its main functions and features.
Keywords
Words that are associated with the app. They are used to make it easier to find an app in the App Store.
Support URL
A link to the support service of the created app.
Marketing (URL)
Link to a product or company.
The parameter is optional.
Copyright
The name of the person or organization that owns the unique rights to the application.
Build
The selection of a build ready for release will be available after successful download of the app in the
Mobile Applications
section of the GreenData personal account.
Information for checking the app
Select "Login required" and specify "Username" and "Password" for the test account, which Apple moderators can use to check the app before publishing.
If any additional actions are required to log in to the app, in addition to entering the test account data, they must be described in the "Note" field. Contact information is entered to connect moderators with a contact person in case of problems.
Release of the App Store version
It is recommended to leave the "Release this version automatically" option selected.
After making changes on this page, click "Save".
On the left, in the "Information App" section, add information about the permissions to the app content, select the category in which the app will be located in the App Store, and set an age limit.
In the App Privacy section, add a link to the privacy policy for the app, as well as provide information about the data collection rules.
In the Pricing and Availability section, select how the app will be distributed (paid/free), as well as the countries in which the application will be available.
More information about entering data about the app is described on the Apple website on the
App information
page.
After making changes, click "Save".
Testing the build in the App Store
In case of successful upload of the app from the GreenData personal account, the build of the first version of the app will appear in the Apple App Store Connect account on the app page in the "TestFlight" section.
If the upload of the assembly image from the GreenData personal account was successful, but the build did not appear in the "TestFlight" section of the Apple App Store Connect website, it is recommended to check incoming email messages from Apple, and also double-check that the icons added to the personal account do not contain transparent layers.
If there have been no messages from Apple and the images do not contain transparent layers, contact the
GreenData support
.
To test the version, click
next to the "Internal testing" item before publishing.
In the window that opens, click
next to "Testers".
Next, specify the testers who are supposed to test the app internally and send them invitations by clicking "Add". After confirming the invitation, the testers will have access to testing the build.
The testers must have the TestFlight app installed on the testing mobile devices intended.
If the necessary testers are not in the list of testers, add them to the "Users and Access" section in the Apple App Store Connect. For testers, the "Developer" and the "Reports" roles will be enough.
Publishing an app in the App Store
After testing the application or immediately after uploading it (and testing is nor required), the app can be published in the App Store for public access.
To do this, on the appn page in the Apple App Store Connect, go to the "Distribution" tab, select the desired build number in the "Build" section, double-check all data before sending and click on the "Done", then on the "Submit for Review", then in the window that opens click on the "Send for App review".
Next, the app is sent for review by Apple.
For new mobile apps hosted on the App Store, the review process of the first version usually takes no more than 12 hours.
Each app update also goes through a review process, which usually takes no more than 24 hours. This is important to consider when planning the release dates.
If problems are found, the moderators leave their comments in the "App Review" section or send them to an email from the Apple ID specified during registration in the Apple Developer account. To successfully pass the review, fix the problems specified in comments, create a new build of the app (if necessary) and re-submit it for review.
Contact the
GreenData Support
in case requested changes cannot be done.
App Updates
In the future, to update the app, first create a new version by clicking
next to the "iOS App" in the "Distribution" tab on the app page. The version number is indicated according to the
uploaded via the GreenData
personal account.
Additionally, "What’s new in this version?" field will appear that is required to be filled in. In this field, it is required to specify the main new features, fixes, or text expressing generalized gratitude to users, thanks to which it was possible to identify and improve the stability of the app.
In the "Build" section below, select the build to update, and then click "Done" again. Then click "Submit for Review" and "Submit for Review" again in a new window.
Apple-verified apps and updates appear in the App Store within 24 hours.
